publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

history.provenance: found in Qizil Miŋ-Öyduring T III MQ 73.4

language.ana: frg:ls-cetom-classical frg:ls-cetom-aberrant-archaic frg:ls-peyrot-A3 frg:ls-C14 frg:ls-malzahn-A5 frg:ls-C14 frg:ls-tamai-A2 frg:ls-C14

seg.seg: … [and] he enjoys that—[and] his sperm [lit. filth] comes out, then he commits a saṃghāvaśeṣa offence.
If his sperm [lit. filth] does not come out, as often as he (moves) it up and down towards [his] fist, so often he commits a grave (sthūla) offence that has to be confessed to the whole community.

If feelings of lust arise in the mind of a monk—his penis [lit. shame] stands high, he takes it in his fist, he squeezes it [and] he enjoys that—[and] his sperm [lit. filth] comes out, then he commits a saṃghāvaśeṣa offence.

If there arise feelings of lust in the mind of a monk—his penis [lit. shame] stands high, he takes it in his fist, he squeezes it [and] he enjoys that—[and] his sperm [lit. filth] comes out, then he commits a saṃghāvaśeṣa offence.

[Wenn] sich dem Mönche Begierden im Denken erheben [und wenn] ihm der Schamort emporsteht, [und wenn] er es in die Faust nimmt [und] es drückt [und wenn] er daran Gefallen findet [und wenn] ihm Schmutz herauskommt, [so] begeht er ein Saṅghāvaśeṣa-Vergehen.

[If] desires arise in the thought of a monk, [and if] his pubic place stands erect, [and if] he takes it into [his] fist [and] squeezes it [and if] he finds pleasure in it, [and if] foulness comes out, [then] he commits a Saṅghāvaśeṣa-offence.
If his sperm [lit. filth] does not come out, as often as he squeezes it, so often he commits a grave (sthūla) offence that has to be confessed to the whole community.

If there arise feelings of lust in the mind of a monk—his penis [lit. shame] stands high, he touches it with his fingers, he measures it [and] he enjoys that—[and] his sperm [lit. filth] comes out, then he commits a saṃghāvaśeṣa offence.
... [wenn] ihn der Schamort emporsteht [und] [wenn] er es mit [seinen] Fingern berührt [und] Maß nimmt ...
... [if] his pubic place stands erect [and] [if] he touches it with [his] fingers [and] sizes [it] up ...
If his sperm [lit. filth] does not come out, as often as he touches it, so often he commits a grave (sthūla) offence that has to be confessed to the whole community.

If there arise feelings of lust in the mind of a monk—his penis [lit. shame] stands high, he touches it with a rag [and] he enjoys that—[and] his sperm [lit. filth] comes out, then he commits a saṃghāvaśeṣa offence.

[Wenn] sich dem Mönch Begierden im Denken erheben [und wenn] ihm der Schamort emporsteht, [und wenn] er es mit einem Lappen berührt [und] daran Gefallen findet [und wenn] ihm Schmutz herauskommt, [so] begeht er ein Saṃghāvaśeṣa-Vergehen.

[If] desires arise in the thought of a monk, [and if] his pubic place stands erect, [and if] he touches it with a rag [and] finds pleasure in it [and if] foulness comes out, [then] he commits a Saṃghāvaśeṣa offence.
If his sperm [lit. filth] does not come out, as often as he touches it with the rag, so often he commits a grave (sthūla) offence that has to be confessed to the whole community.

If there arise feelings of lust in the mind of a monk—his penis [lit. shame] stands high, he rubs it between his thighs [and] he enjoys that—[and] his sperm [lit. filth] comes out, then he commits a saṃghāvaśeṣa offence.

[Wenn] sich dem Mönche Begierden im Denken erheben [und wenn] ihm der Schamort emporsteht, [und wenn] er es zwischen den Schenkeln reibt [und] daran Gefallen findet [und wenn] ihm Schmutz herauskommt, [dann] begeht er ein Saṅghāvaśeṣa-Vergehen. [Wenn] ihm nicht Schmutz herauskommt, sooft er [es] zwischen den Schenkeln reibt, (sooft begeht er grobe Vergehen [sthūlātyaya], die vor [wtl. in] der ganzen Gemeinde zu beichten sind).

[If] desires arise in the thought of a monk, [and if] his pubic place stands erect, [and if] he rubs it between [his] thighs [and] finds pleasure in it, [and if] foulness comes out, [then] he commits a Saṅghāvaśeṣa-offence. [If] no foulness comes out, as often as he rubs [it] between [his] thighs, (as often he commits grave offences [sthūlātyaya], that must be confessed before [lit. in] the entire community).
If his sperm [lit. filth] does not come out, as often as he rubs it between his thighs, (so often he commits a grave (sthūla) offence that has to be confessed to the whole community).

p.note: In general, this manuscript is written in the standard script type, but it still shows an archaic-shaped 〈ṣa〉 (cf. 264).
According to 217, the ī in īke could also be short.

list.item: a4, a8, b3, b7 According to [[TochSprR(B) II]]: 217, the ī in īke could also be short.

a1 tune swāralñe yamast_r_a krāke _l_aṃn-ne saṅghā-t_r_aṅkä _k_a_t_aṅ_k_aṃ kr_ui mā krā«ke» _l_aṃn-ne a2 ko_s\s tu māka ette ke_uwcä maścäś\ to_t\ stulāṃñcana t_r_aṅkänta _k_atta a3 ṅ_k_aṃ po sāṅne teśi_tä ya«ma»_ṣ_allo«na» 4 ṣamānentse yśelmi _p_alskone tsa a4 ṅkaṃ kwipe ike ke_uwco ka_l\l_t_a_r\r-ne «tu» maśne eṅkas_t_a_r\ nuska_ṣ_ṣ_aṃn-ne a5 tune swāralyñe yamas_t_a_r\ krāke _l_anne saṅghā-t_r_aṅ(k)ä _k_a[_t_a] a6 ṅ_k_aṃ mā krāke _l_aṃn-ne ko_s\s [tu] māka nuska_ṣ_ṣ_aṃ to_t\ stulāṃñcana a7 t_r_aṅkänta _k_a_t_aṅ_k_aṃ po sāṅne teśit yama_ṣ_allona 5 ṣamā[ne] a8 ntse yśelmi _p_alskone tsaṅkaṃ kwipe īke ke_uwco ka_l\l_t_a_r\r-ne [t](u) – a9 rontsa yaṣ_t_a_r\ yarmä yamas_t_a_r\ tune swāralyñe yamas(_t_a_r\ krāke) a10 _l_aṃn-ne saṅgha-t_r_aṅko _k_a_t_aṅ_k_a[ṃ] blank b1 kr_ui mā krāke _l_aṃn-ne ko_s\s ttu māka prāroṃntsa ceśaṃ to_t\ stulāṃ-t_r_aṅk[o](nta _k_a) b2 _t_aṅ_k_aṃ po sāṅne teśi_tä yama_ṣ_alona 6 ṣamānentse yśe[l](mi _p_a) b3 lskone tsaṅkaṃ kwipe īke ke_uwco ka_l\l_t_a_r\r-ne tu kretswesa yaṣ_t_a_r\ [tu] b4 ne swāralyñe yamas_t_a_r\ kr(ā)ke _l_aṃn-ne saṅghā-t_r_aṅko _k_a_t_aṅ_k_aṃ kr_ui mā krā b5 ke _l_aṃn-ne ko_s\s tu māka kretswesa ceśaṃ to_t\ sttul(ā)ṃ-(t_r_a)ṅko b6 koṃnta _k_a_t_aṅ_k_aṃ po sāṅne teśitä ya_ṣ_alona 7 ṣamāneṃntse yśe b7 lmi _p_alskone tsaṅkaṃ kwipe īke ke_uwco ka_l\l_t_a_r\r-ne _m_alyuwiñcä epi b8 ṅkte kluṣnā_t_a_r\r-ne tune swāralyñe yamas_t_a_r\ krāke _l_aṃn-ne saṅghā-t_r_aṅko b9 _k_a_t_aṅ_k_aṃ kr_ui mā kkrāke _l_aṃn-ne ko_s\ māka _m_alyuwiṃñco epiṅkte kluṣnāt_r_a

Peyrotarchaic ~ classical
Malzahnarchaic ~ standard
TamaiI-2 (400-500)
Tamai-C14–

a1 … [and] he enjoys that—[and] his sperm [lit. filth] comes out, then he commits a saṃghāvaśeṣa offence. 693
a1-3 If his sperm [lit. filth] does not come out, as often as he (moves) it up and down towards [his] fist, so often he commits a grave (sthūla) offence that has to be confessed to the whole community. 693
a3-6 If feelings of lust arise in the mind of a monk—his penis [lit. shame] stands high, he takes it in his fist, he squeezes it [and] he enjoys that—[and] his sperm [lit. filth] comes out, then he commits a saṃghāvaśeṣa offence. 336, 693
a3-6 If there arise feelings of lust in the mind of a monk—his penis [lit. shame] stands high, he takes it in his fist, he squeezes it [and] he enjoys that—[and] his sperm [lit. filth] comes out, then he commits a saṃghāvaśeṣa offence. 336, 693
a6-7 If his sperm [lit. filth] does not come out, as often as he squeezes it, so often he commits a grave (sthūla) offence that has to be confessed to the whole community. 693
a7-10 If there arise feelings of lust in the mind of a monk—his penis [lit. shame] stands high, he touches it with his fingers, he measures it [and] he enjoys that—[and] his sperm [lit. filth] comes out, then he commits a saṃghāvaśeṣa offence. 694
b1-2 If his sperm [lit. filth] does not come out, as often as he touches it, so often he commits a grave (sthūla) offence that has to be confessed to the whole community. 694
b2-4 If there arise feelings of lust in the mind of a monk—his penis [lit. shame] stands high, he touches it with a rag [and] he enjoys that—[and] his sperm [lit. filth] comes out, then he commits a saṃghāvaśeṣa offence. 694
b4-6 If his sperm [lit. filth] does not come out, as often as he touches it with the rag, so often he commits a grave (sthūla) offence that has to be confessed to the whole community. 694
b6-9 If there arise feelings of lust in the mind of a monk—his penis [lit. shame] stands high, he rubs it between his thighs [and] he enjoys that—[and] his sperm [lit. filth] comes out, then he commits a saṃghāvaśeṣa offence. 694
b9 If his sperm [lit. filth] does not come out, as often as he rubs it between his thighs, (so often he commits a grave (sthūla) offence that has to be confessed to the whole community). 694

Translations from [[Schmidt KT 1974]]
Lines Translation Pages
a3-6 [Wenn] sich dem Mönche Begierden im Denken erheben [und wenn] ihm der Schamort emporsteht, [und wenn] er es in die Faust nimmt [und] es drückt [und wenn] er daran Gefallen findet [und wenn] ihm Schmutz herauskommt, [so] begeht er ein Saṅghāvaśeṣa-Vergehen. 344
a8-9 ... [wenn] ihn der Schamort emporsteht [und] [wenn] er es mit [seinen] Fingern berührt [und] Maß nimmt ... 328
b2-4 [Wenn] sich dem Mönch Begierden im Denken erheben [und wenn] ihm der Schamort emporsteht, [und wenn] er es mit einem Lappen berührt [und] daran Gefallen findet [und wenn] ihm Schmutz herauskommt, [so] begeht er ein Saṃghāvaśeṣa-Vergehen. 481
b6ff, [Wenn] sich dem Mönche Begierden im Denken erheben [und wenn] ihm der Schamort emporsteht, [und wenn] er es zwischen den Schenkeln reibt [und] daran Gefallen findet [und wenn] ihm Schmutz herauskommt, [dann] begeht er ein Saṅghāvaśeṣa-Vergehen. [Wenn] ihm nicht Schmutz herauskommt, sooft er [es] zwischen den Schenkeln reibt, (sooft begeht er grobe Vergehen [sthūlātyaya], die vor [wtl. in] der ganzen Gemeinde zu beichten sind). 326-7
In general, this manuscript is written in the standard script type, but it still shows an archaic-shaped 〈<u>ṣa</u>〉 (cf. [[Malzahn 2007a]]: 264).
